reviewText: I have been looking for this movie for years. I had it on VCR tape and someone lifted it. It's a movie for everyone. No matter what country you're form there's always mischief at boarding school. There's a word used in the movie by the boys, that influenced my boyfriend to use it as his email address.
Love this movie so much!
This was cute and charming movie, of a young boy trying to fit in.
Encourages everyone to enjoy being the person you are created to be!
Very cute and touching movie.
Loved this cute movie.  Very enjoyable.
Not sure why this movie was ever made! Weak, predictable total fluff. No reason for Edward Fox and Vincent Price to be involved in this failed project.
Great ensemble piece!  The kids are terrific!!
Very fun boys that cook .
Writing is somewhat trite but in terms of a fun movie...cute, adorable, charming....and when it comes down that is spot on for this product
A delightful, funny little movie that should be seen by more people!
Great

This movie was MUCH better than I thought it would be.  It's relatable and endearing and my 13 year old son sat through the whole thing without making a (derogatory) remark.
Interesting take on boys' school and overcoming pressure.
Must not have liked it as I don't remember it.

Oh Captain, my Captain.  But only if the dead poets were hungry, lacked the brilliant Mr. Williams, and were trapped in a movie which could only be described as plodding, slow, with zero character development.  Actually, that only means the similarities are a boys boarding school with a secret midnight society.  It's plodding and slow because there's so very little plot that much stretching is required.  Oddly, they didn't fill in the plot gaps with explanation of anyone's motivation, and therefore, you don't care about any of them.  Maybe, possibly, a half-hour after school program, and maybe, possibly, if it had been aired about 10 years before it were filmed.  I could see a third grader me in about 1983 enjoying this.
A lovely, funny movie that is poignant and fun for family viewing. My ten year old daughter enjoyed it, and has asked to watch it again more than once.
Fun little film.  Good sunday night family film.
Such a sweet treat! Thank you so much for the opportunity to watch this gem!
It's like Harry Potter with food.
Such a great film. Uplifting. Sweet. Good hearted fun for the whole family.
Took me away to figure out how to load it to my lap top to watch. This is a good family movie. Nice story.
This is a sweet movie to watch by yourself and with kids. It teaches how to get along and how to use your talents and individuality to make friends. So sweet.
Family friendly, cute story, funny, light hearted, enjoyable, British humor, sweet, shows importance of letting kids explore the world around them, and the value of family
This is a film that can be watched over and over again! The characters are very believable and genuine, and the plot is captivating. Everyone in the family will love this picture!
Holds even an adults interest.  You want to cheer the boys on, and you will.
Great family movie

I could not help but to love this movie.  We've shared it with lots of guests and visitors usually after dinner on a lazy Sunday afternoon.  Everyone loves it.  How brilliant for families and children to see a charming British movie about a young boy in a boarding school that channels being bullied for not being good at sports into forming a gang of nerds that become a secretive cooking cult that meets at midnight in the school's cafeteria kitchen.  Beautiful countryside, filming and scenery too.
It's weird, it's funny, it's sad, if you love Sir Christopher Lee, you'll get a kick out of this!

A Feast at Midnight has all of the basic ingredients for a 5-star rating the easy way: a bunch of mischievous boys at a boarding school, a good-hearted but incompetent headmaster, a tyrannical supervisor. And yet, unlike the dishes a bunch of kids made, the movie never gelled properly. As a group (though with considerable variation) the kids' acting abilities were at best mediocre. (At that young age, the director is clearly to blame for this failure.) And the script, despite certain contrived events, never generated sufficient sparkle. To put it differently, the film was not that funny. Nor did it kindle feelings such as deep sadness, sympathy, etc. In short, this movie failed. 2 1/2 stars

I really WANTED to like this movie.  Sort of a cross between Julie & Julia and Dead Poet's Society.  Gove, a bullied boarding student with the singular talent of cooking well and an ability to muster other unpopular boys, sneaks into the school kitchen to cook up sweets.  An interesting premise that, to me, never felt like it rounded out well.  I was looking forward to an uplifting story about the underdog who prevails and succeeds.  With few exceptions, the characters seemed rather flat, the plot ho-hum, and the denouement disappointing.  The humorous scenes weren't all that funny, the potential for pathos glossed over.  Oh well!
Simple and delightful movie for the whole family.
Excellent
Like

Absolutely terrible cover art ...not sure where they got it - almost makes it seem like it will be animated (it's not). Anyways, there are a few linguistic hurdles for any non-Britons, but an otherwise great family film, destined to make you hungry and appreciate good food and friends.
